channel.title: Trying to play a game in Ubuntu
channel.description: Well, I've tried numerous times trying to pay Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare in Ubuntu Linux 11.04 under Wine 1.2.3, and wine 1.3(beta). I've also tried mw2, but I accidentally deleted it and I didn't want to wait again. So, yeah, I downloaded COD4 from thepiratebay.org I got the cod4 proper skidrow. Now, everything installed correctly, but I kept getting an error while trying to enter a game "directx error: directx encountered an unrecoverable error" I've tried re-installing cod4, and re-installing wine. I have directx installed under winetricks, and it still won't work for me. This happens for both single player and multiplayer. I've patched the game to 1.7, and nothing works. I can load the menu scren, but when I try to play a game or something, a dialogue box opens up and it gives me that error. Does anyone know how to fix this, or can someone give me some info that might help?

item.title: Trying to play a game in Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:2, topic:398425”][quote author=sageofmali link=topic=495561.msg3623111#msg3623111 date=1307606264]
Well, I’ve tried numerous times trying to pay Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare in Ubuntu Linux 11.04 under Wine 1.2.3, and wine 1.3(beta). I’ve also tried mw2, but I accidentally deleted it and I didn’t want to wait again. So, yeah, I downloaded COD4 from thepiratebay.org I got the cod4 proper skidrow. Now, everything installed correctly, but I kept getting an error while trying to enter a game “directx error: directx encountered an unrecoverable error” I’ve tried re-installing cod4, and re-installing wine. I have directx installed under winetricks, and it still won’t work for me. This happens for both single player and multiplayer. I’ve patched the game to 1.7, and nothing works. I can load the menu scren, but when I try to play a game or something, a dialogue box opens up and it gives me that error. Does anyone know how to fix this, or can someone give me some info that might help?
[/quote]

Use windows.

Not all applications, or games will work in wine. Wine Is Not an Emulator. I’m surprised that WoW works at all.

As the Wine developers as stated numerous times, they haven’t even scratched the surface on partial compatibility.[/quote]
Lol, people have gotten it to work under wine, and I can’t really do it on windows because, I host on my computer. Also, my brothers are always using the laptops, so, I’m gonna try virtualbox.

Read full topic
item.source: Trying to play a game in Ubuntu

item.title: Trying to play a game in Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

sageofmali:

Well, I’ve tried numerous times trying to pay Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare in Ubuntu Linux 11.04 under Wine 1.2.3, and wine 1.3(beta). I’ve also tried mw2, but I accidentally deleted it and I didn’t want to wait again. So, yeah, I downloaded COD4 from thepiratebay.org I got the cod4 proper skidrow. Now, everything installed correctly, but I kept getting an error while trying to enter a game “directx error: directx encountered an unrecoverable error” I’ve tried re-installing cod4, and re-installing wine. I have directx installed under winetricks, and it still won’t work for me. This happens for both single player and multiplayer. I’ve patched the game to 1.7, and nothing works. I can load the menu scren, but when I try to play a game or something, a dialogue box opens up and it gives me that error. Does anyone know how to fix this, or can someone give me some info that might help?

Use windows.

Not all applications, or games will work in wine. Wine Is Not an Emulator. I’m surprised that WoW works at all.

As the Wine developers as stated numerous times, they haven’t even scratched the surface on partial compatibility.

Read full topic
item.source: Trying to play a game in Ubuntu
